title: Root mean square
summary:
In mathematics and its applications, the root mean square (RMS or RMS or rms) is defined as the square root of the mean square (the arithmetic mean of the squares of a set of numbers).[1]
The RMS is also known as the quadratic mean[2][3] and is a particular case of the generalized mean with exponentÂ 2. RMS can also be defined for a continuously varying function in terms of an integral of the squares of the instantaneous values during a cycle.
